Overview

South Ribble Borough Council's spending data reveals £145.9 million in external payments across 16,065 transactions with 1,661 unique suppliers from 2021/22 to 2024/25.

With a population of 111,600, this translates to approximately £327 per resident per year in external payments over £500.

The Shared Services Effect

South Ribble shares a Chief Executive and back-office functions with Chorley Borough Council. This is reflected in the £10.9 million paid to Chorley (7.5% of total spend). When analysing South Ribble's spending, this inter-council transfer should be considered as internal shared-service costs rather than truly external expenditure.
